newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Optus chairman says late 1996 float on track.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Optus chairman says late 1996 float on track.

text.p: Optus Communications Pty Ltd chairman Russell Fynmore said on Tuesday that the share market listing of Australia's second telecommunications carrier was still set for sometime later in calendar 1996.
"You might have heard that Optus Communications is planning to float sometime this year," he said in a luncheon speech to the Committee for the Economic Development of Australia (CEDA).

"Having said that, there is not much I am able to say about Optus' own future, except to confirm we are still on track for a listing sometime before the end of the year (subject to the necessary regulatory approvals)," he said.
"Now I really can't say any more about our plans for Optus," Fynmore said in his speech, which otherwise dealt with industry deregulation from July next year and general competition issues.
The largest single shareholder in Optus is local transport and healthcare group Mayne Nickless Ltd with a 25 percent stake.
Next are two companies each with a 24.5 percent holding -- BellSouth Corp and Cable and Wireless Plc.
Other smaller shareholders include local life offices AMP Society and National Mutual, and the Australian government's investment group AIDC.
